title: The Doomsday Quatrain
author: Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie
filename: 151 - The Doomsday Quatrain - Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: INT. STAIRCASE/LANDING/BEDROOM
OFF, UPSTAIRS) (GROANS, GIBBERS, HAVING NIGHTMARE, THROUGH:
(FX: RUNNING UPSTAIRS) Master! Master Nostradamus!
FX: CROSSES LANDING, OPENS DOOR
Not again..! (FX: RUSHES TO BEDSIDE; SHAKES NOSTRADAMUS) Wake
up! Master Nostradamus! Please, wake up!
(COMES TO, PANTING, CONFUSED) The sea. I saw... the sea.
A nightmare, master. Only a nightmare. Here, have some wine. —
FX: WINE POURED FROM BEDSIDE JUG
No, Milo. Not a nightmare... and wine is not what I need! (FX:
AWAY WINE CUP) Parchment and quill! There, on the desk! (FX: MILO’S FOOTSTEPS ACROSS ROOM AND BACK) Hurry, boy! Hurry!
Here, master. —
FX: FRANTIC SCRATCHING OF QUILL PEN ON PARCHMENT
(WHISPERING) All falls.. into a grey and endless sea.
The same vision again, master?
Yes, and no. I see how it ends now.
How what ends, master?
Everything. The world. It’s already begun.
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 2: EXT. FLORENCE BACKSTREET/INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FX: CROWD BUSTLE OFF. TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS
No, that’s not right. Not right at all.
(FX: DOOR BANGS SHUT, CUTTING OUT EXT NOISE. FOLLOW DOCTOR AS HE CROSSES TO TV MOVIE CONSOLE)
(FX: BLEEPS ETC) Let’s try that again, shall we? (FX:
BEGINS OVER) Planet Celdor... here we come.
FX: BEAT. MATERIALISATION
Good. (FX: PATS CONSOLE) Much better.
FX: FOOTSTEPS TO DOOR. DOOR OPENS. CROWD BUSTLE AS BEFORE
(SIGHS) Apparently not.
FX: DOOR CLOSES, FOOTSTEPS. DECISIVE THUNK ON TARDIS CONSOLE
You know, I thought we’d agreed not to do this anymore.
FX: MORE THUNKS AND BLEEPS
No, no, no. I know what the instrumentation says, but it’s not Celdor, is it? Look outside! (SIGHS) Very well. Be that way. (FX: WALKING BACK TO DOOR) I ask for Celdor, you give me...
FX: OPENS DOOR. CROWD BUSTLE. DISTANT CHIMES OF BELL TOWER
(SNIFFS AIR) Yes, the rising whiff of artistic and intellectual renaissance. Florence. No later than 1560, I’d guess. Best leave the umbrella.
FX: CLATTER OF UMBRELLA BEING THROWN INTO TARDIS
(TO TARDIS) And you’d better be feeling more co-operative when
I return!
FX: TARDIS DOOR CLOSES. CROSSFADE TO:
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 3: EXT. MARKET SQUARE
FX: BUSY MARKET CROWDS. SQUAWKING CHICKENS ETC
The finest fashions! Silks and feathers! As worn by Catherine de Medici herself, and may the Plague catch me if I tell a lie!
3 x HAWKERS:
Fish! I got fish! It ain’t fresh, but it’s all there is!/ Spices! Oriental spices! Stop that fish from stinking!/ Knives! Knives to grind! [ETC]
FX: CALLS CONTINUE SPORADICALLY UNDER:
(FX: WALKING PAST, QUICKLY) Not today! No, no, no!
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Master Nostradamus?
I said, not today! I’m in a hurry! —
Please! Master Nostradamus, it’s Lady Garilund. Don’t you remember me from yesterday?
(STOPPING) My dear Lady Garilund, I apologise. I thought you might have been one of my, shall we say, more enthusiastic followers. Are you well? Managed to find a husband since yesterday?
Not as yet. I was wondering if I might ask you about your prophecies. I’ve been reading them.
I see. Not a relative of the Duke of Medici, are you?
No, why?
He is always sending people to ask me about my prophecies, and they’re usually carrying weapons.
Why? What did you do?
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 6
I predicted his death. He disapproved.
I was just wondering, how do they come to you? Your prophecies? Do you get headaches, fits, nightmares, anything like that?
Sometimes. That’s a very strange question, my dear.

(FX: UNFURLING PAPERS) What happened when you made this prophecy? (READING) ‘When the river is gone, ships shall sail in the sky, monsters bring fire from the heavens. All will fall into a grey and endless sea, and Doomsday has come.’
One hundred quatrains in there... and you ask me about that one.
These monsters, what did they look like?
(TRYING TO DEPART) My Lady, I have no time for this just now...
(BLOCKING HIM) Please, tell me! What did you see?
I have to go home. I have appointments to keep.
The monsters, they were like walking crocodiles, weren’t they?
If they were, they were merely the product of bad wine and ill vapours.
You know. You know what’s happening!
Good day to you, my lady. (SETS OFF, WALKING FAST)
(CALLING AFTER) Please, wait! I can help! (TO SELF) I can save you...
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 4: INT. KRO CONCLAVE WARSHIP
FX: HEAVY DOORS GRIND OPEN
(ANNOUNCING) Blueskin leader here, Honoured Nuncio.
Bring him in. In!
(ENTERING) Thank you. (TO FIRST NUNCIO) Honoured Nuncio of the First Spear, I come with news... (BREAKS OFF) Forgive me, you appear different from the last time we spoke.
My predecessor. Command Conclave displeased at her failure in fee negotiations. I previously Second Spear Nuncio, now First Spear.
I see. Well, I am Chief Administrator Brors, head of the Poldagon [science facility] —
I know. Am fully up to date on situation, after ingesting brain-meat and memories of predecessor.
Oh. How thorough. —
Say what you came to say!
Yes, of course. We expect the test zone to be ready on schedule.
And you lower fee?
My apologies, I already lowered the fee for your predecessor —
Scans show test zone incomplete! Kro dishonoured. Kro demand new fee.
Some fluid mass is still processing, but we are confident that it will be complete in time.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 8
Proposition not acceptable.

Your troops will have the battle experience that was agreed. As Chief Administrator, I give my word. All of the test zone, and life forms on it, are the property of Kro, for the duration of the operation, to do with as they wish.
(GROWLS, MULLING THIS OVER) Proposition acceptable. Leave now.
Thank you, Honoured Nuncio.
FX: WALKS; WE FOLLOW HIM INTO CORRIDOR
FX: HEAVY DOORS CLOSE BEHIND BRORS
Overgrown lizards. (FX: OPENS COM-PORT, RADIO HISS) Facilitator Kren?
(ON RADIO) Kren here, Chief Administrator.
Ready to port back now. Is everything ready for the start of the operation? It has to go like clockwork!
(ON RADIO) Sir, there may be a problem.
Let me guess, our Second Researcher isn’t back yet?
(ON RADIO) No, sir. She’s still pursuing her test subject, sir.
(SIGHS) Very well. Lock on and port me to her current location. I’1ll try and talk some sense into her.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 5: INT. NOSTRADAMUS’ HOUSE
FX: INSISTENT KNOCKING ON FRONT DOOR
(BUSTLING UP) Coming, I’m coming —
FX: DOOR OPENS, STREET SOUNDS FROM OUTSIDE
(SURPRISED) Master Nostradamus? But you are home so soon —
(RUSHING IN, BREATHLESS) Close the door, Milo. Hurry, hurry!
FX: DOOR CLOSED
Oh, but you are exhausted. Please, come settle yourself down.
FX: INSISTENT KNOCKING AT DOOR
(FX: FROM OUTSIDE) Master Nostradamus! Please!
But — isn’t that...?
The Lady Garilund, yes. I’m not here!
What happened?
She wants to know all about my prophecy. So many questions.
About which prophecy, master?
The prophecy!
(FX: MORE KNOCKING) Just a few more questions. That’s all!
Get rid of her, Milo. I wish to retire upstairs. No visitors!
Yes, master.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 10
(WALKING UPSTAIRS) Not unless they’re people with coin, anda willingness to spend it. Wealthy widows, foreign travellers. No
riff-raff, no pregnant peasant girls without the patience to wait a few months to know if it’s a boy...
FX: CROSS TO:
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 6: EXT. NOSTRADAMUS’ HOUSE
(FX: KNOCKING ON DOOR) It won’t take long. I promise-! (FX:
CREAKS OPEN) Oh, at last —
Lady Garilund.
Milo. Let me in, I must speak with him.
Master Nostradamus is currently unable to receive visitors.
You mean he doesn’t want to see me. You have to make him understand, I must speak to him immediately!
I am to convey to you that Master Nostradamus thanks you for your continued interest in his work, but respectfully asks that you do not return.
I must see him! Let me by!
I’m sorry, my lady. Good day to you.
FX: DOOR CLOSES
You don’t understand. There’s no time! (FX: COM-PORT ACTIVATED,

HISS) This is Second Researcher Garilund, I need to speak to Chief Administrator Brors urgently. I think I’ve found the proof I need, but... (FX: STATIC, TOO-FAINT VOICE ON RADIO) What? I can’t hear you. (FX: STATIC, TOO FAINT VOICE ON RADIO) What? Brors is here? Where? (FX: STATIC, TOO-FAINT VOICE ON RADIO) Okay, I’m on my way. Garilund out.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 12
SCENE 7: EXT. MARKET SQUARE
FX: MARKET BUSTLE AS BEFORE
CALLING OUT) The finest silks! Fit for a duke! .. (TO DOCTOR
Ah, a foreign gentleman, I see. You are a guest in Florence?
A guest, yes. Always a guest, never a host. Or something like that.
My name is Bernardo. As you can see from my stall, I have the best cloth in all Florence! I can tell by the cut of your clothes, you are a traveller. I’ve never seen cloth so... exotic in my trade.
Oh, thank you. I think.
On your tunic, are these the symbol of your state?
Of my state of mind, perhaps. Confused.
(RANTING TO CROWDS, OFF) It is a sign, I tell you! A portent! I hear word, the same has happened in Siena! It is the end! The end of all the world!
(TO HIMSELF) Interesting.
Pay no heed, sir. The streets are full of lunatics, since the river vanished.
The river-? That is unusual. Does anyone know the cause?
The Medicis blame the Albizzis. The Albizzis blame the Venetians — no change there — but I hear the Venetians are too busy wading through the mud between their islands now to notice.
(TO SELF) Venice without its canals, but the TARDIS brings me to Florence. Typical. (TO BERNARDO) When did all this start?
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 13
Only yesterday. If you are going to Venice, I have the very latest in Venetian fashion here. —
FX: RUSTLING OF MATERIAL AND BOXES
That won’t be necessary. I don’t think feathers are really me.
(OFF) I warn you, the doomsday is coming! Just as Nostradamu foretold!
(TO SELF) Nostradamus, eh?
You know him, sir?
Not really, but his wife once knitted me a rather fetching scarf. Or will. So what’s he predicted this time?
Some nonsense about flying ships in the sky, talking crocodiles, the world ending and so on. You know how seers a If you ask me, the city guard should lock them all up.
(FX: APPROACHING FROM OFF, PUSHING THROUGH CROWD) Excuse me... SOrTy...
Yes, that’s usually what happens with anyone saying things people don’t want to hear. Good day to you, [Bernardo —]
(JOSTLES INTO DOCTOR) Oh! I beg your pardon, sir.
Not at all. My fault entirely.
No matter. I must be going. — (MOVES OFF)
Now there’s a lady in a hurry.
The Lady Garilund, sir. A visitor, like yourself. Bit of an one, she is.
Ss
re.
odd
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 14
More than you think.
Been pestering Nostradamus, they say. Probably wants her fortune told, or to learn the name of her future husband. You know how young women are.
Nostradamus again. Excuse me, Bernardo. (MOVES AWAY)
(CALLING AFTER HIM) Wait! Are you sure I can’t sell you a hat?
(CALLING BACK) Sorry, must dash. Have to see a man about the end of the world!
FX: CROSS TO:
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 8: EXT. FLORENCE BACKSTREET
FX: CROWD BUSTLE OFF
(LOUD HISS) Garilund! Here! Over here!
(APPROACHING) Chief Administrator Brors? I wasn’t sure I’d recognise you —
(INTERRUPTING) With my Hologuise on? Don’t be foolish, Second Researcher. You should know the pitch frequency only affects the brains of lesser life-forms. We Poldagons are hardly that.
Sir, I know you’re going to tell me to return. I know I’ve been here over schedule, but [the thing is..]
Your time is up, Second Researcher. The operation starts in less than half a day cycle.
[..] The thing is...
We've discussed this. I can’t understand why you continue to pursue this foolish notion.
With, respect, if you read my paper—
I have read your paper. Your propositions were well presented, but ultimately flawed.
But I’ve found new data to support my theory. Please, sir, I just need more time.
What kind of data?
An individual among the general population. One who exhibits abilities not previously seen in this species.
Not ‘species’, Second Researcher. Bio-units.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 16
Yes, sir. ‘Among this particular class of bio-units.’ I’ve already forwarded my provisional findings to the Poldagon Science Academy, [and —]
The Science Academy? Why?
I’ve got a friend there. He thought my theory bore investigation and asked me to send him any new data I found. If he’s convinced, the Academy may inspect the facility themselves.
I see. (BEAT) How much more time do you need?
One more day-cycle, and I’m sure I can gather evidence to convince you to suspend all operations for the time being.
Very well. Complete your fieldwork. I’1l delay the start of the operation to give you the time you need.
(SURPRISED) Thank you, Chief Administrator. Thank you!
Just assure me of something. This bio-unit you’ve found, you’re sure it exhibits enough of the criteria to satisfy the Academy’s definitions?
I am, sir. You won’t be disappointed, once you inspect it for yourself. He- it lives not far from here. Maybe I could show you?
No time, I’m afraid. I’ve a lot of work to do, especially since I’1l now have to re-negotiate with the client to get you the time you need.
Yes, sir. I can’t tell you how much this means to me.
I want you to understand that this has not been an easy decision for me, Garilund. I want you to remember that.
Yes, sir. I will.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 17
Go and gather your evidence. I look forward to reviewing it in person when we meet again back at the facility.
Yes, sir. And thank you again! (LEAVES)
(TO HIMSELF) Not an easy decision. I really am sorry, Garilund. Very sorry indeed. (FX: RADIO LINK OPENING UP) Kren? I want you to put me through to the clients.
(ON RADIO) A new problem?
Not at all. I’ve good news for them — we’re going to be able to advance the start of the operation, at no extra charge.
(ON RADIO) But Second Researcher Garilund —

. is aware of the situation — I saw to that personally — and will return to us with plenty of time to spare. I’m porting back to the facility. I expect everything to be ready on my arrival. Brors out.
FX: RADIO LINK BROKEN
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 9: INT. NOSTRADAMUS’ HOUSE
FX: KNOCKING ON FRONT DOOR
Not again-! (BUSTLING UP) (ALOUD) I’ve told you once, my Lady. (FX: OPENING DOOR) I don’t want to have to summon the City Guard, but —
Hello. I think you may have been expecting someone else...?
My sincerest apologies, sir. How may I assist?
I’m told that this is the residence of Michel de Nostredame.
Have you come for a reading?
In a manner of speaking.
You're not a foreign traveller, by any chance?
I suppose I am. Why, is that a problem?
Not at all, sir. Please, come in.
(FX: ENTERS. DOOR CLOSED BEHIND) Might I ask, who were you expecting just now?
Master Nostradamus has been receiving some unwanted attention of late. Obsessive types. Won’t give him a moment’s peace. If you'd just wait here, I shall see if he’s free, mister...?
Doctor.
A man of learning. The master will enjoy that. So difficult for him to find someone on his own level to talk to. (FX: EXITS UPSTAIRS)
Yes, I know the feeling.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 10: INT. POLDAGON LABORATORY
FX: AMBIENT WHIRRING OF MACHINERY, AND BUBBLING LIQUID
(INTO RADIO) Garilund? It’s Kren. Are you receiving me? (FX:
STATIC) Do you copy? Garilund!
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN IN B/G
(TO SELF) Where are you...?
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Not still mooning over Garilund, Facilitator Kren?
(STARTLED) Oh! Larrett. It’s you.
You are aware the countdown to the start of the operation has begun?
Forgive me, Larrett, but you’re still just a Third Rank researcher, aren’t you?
For the moment.
Right. So I don’t actually have to pay much attention to anything you say.
No need for hostility. I’m merely trying to ensure that the proper protocols are being observed.
Which includes ensuring all facility personnel are safely out of the test zone before the operation begins. Which is why I’m trying to ascertain the whereabouts of our Second Researcher.
You and Garilund. Why not just ask her out to dinner? Once she shoots you down in flames, we’1ll all be spared your agony.
Thank you, Larrett. Please don’t let me keep you from whatever vital duties they allocate to Third Rank researchers.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 20
(FROM DOORWAY) Quite right, Kren.
Chief Administrator Brors!
Hurry along, Third Researcher.
Yes, sir.
And, er — report to my office, will you, when you have a free moment?
Of course, sir. (LEAVES)
Administrator, I’m experiencing communications problems. I can’t raise Second Researcher Garilund.
Yes, I did try telling the clients that there was little point jamming the communications systems of a planet that hasn’t yet developed any, but they do seem to be sticklers for tradition.
Sir...?
(IGNORING HIM) Now, back to your post. The last thing we need now are any hold-ups in the countdown.
(MORE FORCEFULLY) Sir. You did warn Second Researcher Garilund that zero-hour had been brought forward?
Of course. I hope you’re not implying I’d be so negligent as to expose my staff to danger?
Of course not, sir. —
Good.
. it’s just, I just don’t understand why she hasn’t returned.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 21
Perhaps she has. Perhaps she came back through a different part of the ComPort net, and hasn’t reported for duty yet.
Perhaps.
Yes, I’m sure that’s what must have happened. This is a rather large facility, and the client’s jamming operation may have affected our own internal communications.
That’s possible, I suppose.
Of course it is. We’ll do a facility-wide scan for her... just as soon as the countdown is concluded. Agreed?
(RELUCTANTLY) Yes, sir.
Now, onwards. The sooner we get this operation started, the sooner we can bid goodbye to our current clients. (EXITING) Carry on, Kren...
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 11: INT. NOSTRADAMUS’ STUDY
FX: FIRE CRACKLING IN B/G. DOOR OPENS
The Doctor, master.
Very good, Milo. Leave us now.
FX: DOOR CLOSING
Good morning, Master Nostradamus. (FX: CHAIR SCRAPED BACK) May Tie?
Of course, be seated. (BEAT) And what has brought you here today, Doctor?
As I explained to your manservant, I’m a traveller —
So very far from home, yes. (BEAT) And so... alone.
Most astute. I imagine you say that to all the tourists.
A little obvious, I grant you. But I doubt you are here to talk about your past. The question is — what do you want to know of your future?
As little as possible, as a general rule.
(LAUGHS) There is nothing to fear from seeking answers, Doctor. The future is... open-ended.
Sometimes.
I have seen through time and space, Doctor. From this very room. I’ve seen terrible things, wonderful things!
And all from your armchair. Impressive.
FX: UNFURLING PARCHMENT
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 23
Perhaps we can start with a birth chart? The placing of the stars at birth is a telling guide to a man’s fate. Where were you born?
I don’t think you’d know it.
Try me, Doctor.
Gallifrey.
Charming place. South of France, yes?
Not exactly.
Well, not exactly south. On the way, though, yes?
Perhaps astrology isn’t appropriate, in my case.
Doctor, if you don’t want to know your future, and you don’t want an astrological reading, what do you want to know?
Just one thing. I’d like to know how the world will end.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 12: EXT. NOSTRADAMUS’ HOUSE
FX: STREET BUSTLE OFF. RADIO LINK ACTIVATED, HISS OF STATIC.

(SOTTO, INTO RADIO) Kren? It’s Garilund again. Can you hear me? I’m going to assume you can, and it’s just me who’s not receiving. (BEAT) I’ve decided — there’s too much at stake. I’ve got to get my research subject out of here, before the clients arrive. I know Brors will fire me — breach of research protocol and unauthorised intervention in an ongoing operation — but I really don’t care. Wish me luck... (RUMMAGES IN HER CLOTHING) Oh, and —
FX: TRIGGER SWITCH ACTIVATED, ENERGY WEAPON POWERING UP
I listened to what you said, about not going into the test zone unprotected. Type three energy pistol. Single power setting, stun only. Okay, here I —
(FX: HEAVY FOOTSTEPS COMING UP STREET, CLANK OF WEAPONS AND ARMOUR)
(LOUDLY) Make way! In the name of his Lordship the Duke of Medici, make way for the City Guard!
(INTO RADIO) I’m too late! They’re coming for Nostradamus!
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 13: INT. NOSTRADAMUS’ STUDY
The end of the world? I’m sure it’s a long way off, Doctor.
There’s a man in the market square who say otherwise. And I doubt he’s alone.
People are so easily excited.
Then you didn’t predict that the river would disappear overnight?
They read into my predictions all kinds of things. Why are you so interested, Doctor?
Because I’ve seen the end of the world, and I happen to know that’s not due to happen for a few millennia yet.
You are a seer?
I saw it because I was there.
Doctor, I must request that you leave now. I am getting... tired.
I think you know what is going on. Why won’t you tell me?
(RAISES VOICE) Because there’s nothing to be done about it.
And I thought the future was open-ended.
Not for me.
FX: KNOCKING ON DOOR DOWNSTAIRS
(DOWNSTAIRS) No, Master Nostradamus is not to be [disturbed! ]
FX: FRONT DOOR CRASHES OPEN, OFF
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 26
(MARCHING IN DOWNSTAIRS) Out of the way. We’re here on the Duke’s business!
FX: 2 x GUARDS MARCHING UPSTAIRS, FOLLOWING CAPTAIN
What is the meaning of this commotion?
FX: DOOR CRASHES OPEN
(ENTERING ROOM) Michel de Nostredame? Also known as the prophet and seer Nostradamus?
I am.
You’re under arrest, on charges of panic-mongering and the spreading of false prophecies. You men — take him away.
(FX: GRABBED BY GUARDS) This is an outrage!
Yeah, yeah.
One moment, Captain. The Duke’s business, you said. That would be his Lordship the Duke of Medici, correct?
(TO DOCTOR) What’s it to you? You an acolyte of Nostradamus...?
No, no. He was telling me about the future.
Then we’ve saved you your money. The only future Master Nostradamus has is an appointment with the executioner. (TO GUARDS) Right, men — follow me.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 14: EXT. NOSTRADAMUS’ HOUSE
(FX: EXCITED CROWD GATHERED. DOOR OPENS, NOSTRADAMUS DRAGGED OUT)
They’ve got him! Here he comes!
That’1l teach him! [ETC]
(WEAKLY STRUGGLING) Stop! This is all a terrible mistake!
Some prophet. If he’d seen this coming, he’d have been out the window long before we got here.
FX: LAUGHTER FROM GUARDS
(LOUDLY, TO CROWD) Clear the way!
FX: HEAVY FOOTSTEPS AND CLANKING ARMOUR, RECEDING AWAY
(COMING OUT OF HIDING, WHISPERING INTO RADIO) Kren, they’ve taken my research subject! (HURRYING) I’m following them. I won't be able to use my ComPort — too many witnesses. Tell
Brors! Tell him we must save the subject!
FX: HURRYING FOOTSTEPS, RECEDING
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 28
SCENE 15: INT. BRORS’ OFFICE
FX: KNOCK ON METAL/PLASTIC DOOR
(SLIGHTLY OFF) Come in!
(FX: FOLLOW AS HE ENTERS OFFICE) Chief Administrator. You asked me to report to you, when I had a free moment?
Yes, yes, so I did.. Second Researcher Larrett.
Sir, I’m still just a Third Rank Researcher.
Not any more, Second Researcher. Congratulations.
Thank you, sir. But.. what about Second Researcher Garilund?
Always sad to lose a long-term team member... but, er, her mind seems to have been elsewhere recently. I wasn’t surprised when she told me she wished to step down from her post.
She’s resigned?
With immediate effect. In fact, I doubt we’ll even see her back here after her current field trip is over.
Thank you this opportunity, sir. You won’t regret it.
I’m sure. Oh, and Second Researcher?
Sir?
Let’s keep this between ourselves, for the moment. Garilund was popular with some of the more impressionable members of the team. I wouldn’t want any upsets, not at this time.
Of course, sir. I understand.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 16: EXT. FLORENCE STREET
FX: HEAVY FOOTSTEPS, CLANKING ARMOUR
Where are they taking him?
To the Duke! He’s for it now, that Nostradamus!
(MARCHING) Make way! Make way for the Guard!

GARILUND: SCENE 13: INT. NOSTRADAMUS’ STUDY
NOSTRADAMUS: The end of the world? I’m sure it’s a long way off, Doctor.

DOCTOR: Because I’ve seen the end of the world, and I happen to know that’s not due to happen for a few millennia yet.
NOSTRADAMUS: You are a seer?
DOCTOR: I saw it because I was there.
NOSTRADAMUS: Doctor, I must request that you leave now. I am getting... tired.
DOCTOR: I think you know what is going on. Why won’t you tell me?
NOSTRADAMUS: (RAISES VOICE) Because there’s nothing to be done about it.
DOCTOR: And I thought the future was open-ended.

NOSTRADAMUS: I am.

DOCTOR: No, no. He was telling me about the future.
CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: Then we’ve saved you your money. The only future Master Nostradamus has is an appointment with the executioner. (TO GUARDS) Right, men — follow me.

BRORS: (SLIGHTLY OFF) Come in!
LARRETT: (FX: FOLLOW AS HE ENTERS OFFICE) Chief Administrator. You asked me to report to you, when I had a free moment?
BRORS: Yes, yes, so I did.. Second Researcher Larrett.
LARRETT: Sir, I’m still just a Third Rank Researcher.
BRORS: Not any more, Second Researcher. Congratulations.
LARRETT: Thank you, sir. But.. what about Second Researcher Garilund?
BRORS: Always sad to lose a long-term team member... but, er, her mind seems to have been elsewhere recently. I wasn’t surprised when she told me she wished to step down from her post.
LARRETT: She’s resigned?
BRORS: With immediate effect. In fact, I doubt we’ll even see her back here after her current field trip is over.
LARRETT: Thank you this opportunity, sir. You won’t regret it.
BRORS: I’m sure. Oh, and Second Researcher?
LARRETT: Sir?
BRORS: Let’s keep this between ourselves, for the moment. Garilund was popular with some of the more impressionable members of the team. I wouldn’t want any upsets, not at this time.
LARRETT: Of course, sir. I understand.

LARRETT: SCENE 16: EXT. FLORENCE STREET
MAN IN CROWD: Where are they taking him?
WOMAN IN CROWD: To the Duke! He’s for it now, that Nostradamus!
CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: (MARCHING) Make way! Make way for the Guard!
NOSTRADAMUS: (DRAGGED ALONG) I have done nothing wrong! You cannot treat me like this!
CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: Save it for the Duke, soothsayer!
DOCTOR: (HURRYING UP ALONGSIDE) Captain, if I might intercede...?
CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: (STOPPING) You again?!?
DOCTOR: (STOPPED) Indeed. It concerns your employer, the Duke of Medici. As it happens, I once assisted his great great- grandfather in some bother with the Borgias. As an old friend of the family, if you could get me an audience with the Duke, [then —]
CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: Not my province, sir. I’m just carrying out my orders. (ALOUD) Carry on, you men!
DOCTOR: (ASIDE) Remarkable. No matter which century you’re in or what Side of the universe you’re on, you’ll always run into someone who’s “just carrying out orders”.

GROUND: )
CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: On your feet, you wretch!

DOCTOR: Can’t you see, this man is ill?
NOSTRADAMUS: (CONVULSING) I see it! It’s happening now! In the heavens... darkness, descending...!

NOSTRADAMUS: Soon all the earth is wreathed in smoke and fire. The Hungry Ones make sport with all men, and afterwards... afterwards...

DOCTOR: (STRUGGLING) Help me, man!
NOSTRADAMUS: . afterwards, a great sea of grey rises to consume all. All of it.. the end of everything...

DOCTOR: I see this whole ‘Renaissance and Enlightenment’ thing still has some way to go. It’s not witchcraft, [it’s —]
DOCTOR: (FX: LOUD ROARING OF SPACESHIP ENGINES OVERHEAD. SCREAMS AND SHOUTS FROM CROWD)
MAN IN CROWD: The skies! The skies darken!
WOMAN IN CROWD: Just as the seer predicted!

CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD: What is that noise?
DOCTOR: Spacecraft engines, by the sound of it.
MAN IN CROWD: There, in the clouds! The angels of darkness!
WOMAN IN CROWD: Descending to claim us!

DOCTOR: No, those are spacecraft in the upper atmosphere. A great many
DOCTOR: Spacecraft, admittedly...

CROWD: SCREAMS)

There, in the clouds! The angels of darkness!
Descending to claim us!

SCENE 17: EXT. FLORENCE STREET [CONTINUOUS]
FX: BOMBARDMENT CONTINUES. RUNNING FEET, SHOUTS AND SCREAMS
(RECOVERING) Doctor..? Is all this really happening? You are not trapped with me in one of my visions?
It’s all very real, unfortunately.
Then this truly is the end of the world.

Not unless someone is rewriting the history books. Come on. If the world really is ending, it would be a pity to miss it by getting trampled to death. (EFFORT — HELPING NOSTRADAMUS UP) Come on. (FX: THEY STAGGER OFF)
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 18: INT. POLDAGON CONTROL ROOM
FX: AMBIENT HUM OF MACHINERY, COMPUTER CONSOLES
Surface assault commencing, Administrator.
Thank you, computer. What kind of weapons are they using?
Standard sub-orbital munitions, within pre-agreed power limits.
At the very limits, judging by —
FX: DISTANT RUMBLE IN SKIES — A THUNDERCRACK BEHIND WINDOW
There! What was that?
Thermonuclear munitions being deployed, Southern Hemisphere Continent Two.
Couldn’t keep their scaly fingers off the nuclear button, could they?
FX: ANOTHER DISTANT RUMBLE
Send them an immediate cease and desist, and itemise all damage that exceeds pre-agreed levels. Anything they break, they have to pay for.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 34
SCENE 19: EXT. FLORENCE ALLEY
FX: OFF — BOMBARDMENT, SCREAMS, PANIC ETC
(STOPPING AGAINST WALL, EXHALING) That’s better. Far from the madding crowd. So, where were we?
(EXHALING) Flying vessels in the sky?
Ah yes. Alien invasion. End of the world. Business as usual.
(LOOKING OUT OF ALLEY) So many of them. So many...!
Definitely warships of some kind. Can’t say I recognise the design. Doubtless some species who discovered interstellar travel before they discovered good manners.
FX: CROSS TO CLOSE BY:
(STOPPING, INTO RADIO) Kren, are you there? My ComPort’s not working. I can’t get out of here!
FX: CROSS BACK TO:
Such senseless destruction. Why is this happening?
Let’s ask someone who knows, shall we? Like the mysterious Lady Garilund, for instance...
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 35
SCENE 20: INT. POLDAGON CONTROL ROOM
FX: DOOR OPENING
Ah, Kren.
Administrator, I’m becoming concerned about Garilund. I’ve checked almost everywhere, and —
Have you tried the tertiary ComPort area?
That’s reserved for clients and VIPs only.
And it wouldn’t be just like our impetuous young Garilund to use it, for exactly that reason? She has a fondness for bending the rules.
Yes, sir. She does.
Why don’t you check to see if she ComPorted back there?
Thank-you, sir. I will. (LEAVES)
FX: LOW DISTANT RUMBLE
Computer, put me through to the clients. They need to realise we didn’t build this facility so they could pound it apart.

SCENE 21: EXT. FLORENCE STREET
FX: EXPLOSIONS, SCREAMS. BOMBARDMENT RECEDING THROUGH:
(TO SELF) Why’s everything happening ahead of schedule...? (FX: HITTING OF BUTTONS AND COMPORT BLEEPS OF FAILURE) No good. You really can’t hear me, can you, Kren?
(APPROACHING) Technical trouble?
What? Who are you?
(BEHIND DOCTOR) A question one might ask of you, ‘my Lady’.
Master Nostradamus! Who is this person?
I’m the Doctor. (PATTING POCKETS) And if I can just find my sonic screwdriver... (FINDS IT) Ah!
(BAFFLED) Sonic-? Wait, what are you doing?
Here we go. This isn’t going to be very gentlemanly, so I apologise in advance. (FX: ACTIVATES SCREWDRIVER — QUICK BURST) Let’s see you as you really are.
No!
(FX: ELECTRONIC FAILING SOUND OF GARILUND’S HOLOGUISE
(SHRIEKING AS IF SHE’S BEEN STRIPPED NAKED) My Hologuise!
But — she is blue! Completely blue! What trickery is this?
You heard the Lady. A Hologuise.
I beg you — restore it! Restore it!
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 37
Of course. (FX: ANOTHER QUICK BURST FROM SCREWDRIVER. HOLOGUISE REACTIVATING) There. Everything back as it was, and no harm done. Well, not much.
How... how did you do that? My Hologuise is supposed to be foolproof!
Yes, it probably is. But I’m no fool. I apologise again, but I had to know who — or rather, what — you were.
And? What is she?
A Poldagon. I’ve never seen one so far from home. Studious types, tend to keep themselves to themselves.
You’ve seen such creatures before?
Secretive, too. Their homeworld’s like visiting a library where everything’s kept in the restricted section.
Yes, that sounds like us. Most of us, anyway.
You’re taller than I remember. Although maybe I was taller when I last met then...
Blue-skinned creatures from other worlds. Flying vessels in the sky. Such wonders!
(TO GARILUND) Yes, but those aren’t Poldagon ships up there, are they, my Lady? Not unless your technology’s a lot less advanced than I remember.
No, they’re Kro ships.
The Phalanx of Kro?
You know them, too?
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 38
Of them, but.. (BEAT) What year is this? 1560? This is all wrong. None of this should be happening!
Why not?
Because the Kro won’t achieve star flight for another 400 years. Right now, they should be still on their swamp world, fighting it out between long-snouts and short-tails.
FX: EXPLOSIONS HAVE ENDED BY NOW
Listen. The bombardment, it’s stopped.
Yes...
FX: SPACECRAFT ENGINES, DESCENDING FURTHER
. only because they’re about to land ground troops. (MOVING AWAY) Come on, Michel. Let’s go.
To where?
To talk to the Kro, and try and get them to stop this. (LEAVES)
Talk to the Kro? But they’re— Hey, wait for me! (LEAVES)
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 39

FX: KREN WALKING BRISKLY
(FX: RUNNING UP BEHIND) Facilitator Kren.
If I might-?
No time to talk, Larrett. I’ve got to get to the tertiary ComPort. — (STOPS) Wait, you haven’t seen Garilund?
No. And I’m not expecting to, either.
What do you mean?
Nothing. (GRABBED BY KREN) What are you doing?
Let go of me!
What did you mean, you’re not expecting to see her?
She - she’s only got herself to blame.
For what? Where is she?
Still playing with her beloved bios.
What? Then she’s in real danger!
Which is all her own fault. She won’t be back.
Brors doesn’t think so, either.
Why?
Because he made me Second Researcher.
What? (BEAT — THEN RUSHES OFF THE WAY HE CAME)
Administrator
(CALLING) Wait. Where are you going? The tertiary ComPort is
that way!

FX: HUM OF MACHINERY, CONSOLES
Clients landing ground forces in test zone.
Couldn’t wait to get a taste of blood, could they? Oh well, it’s their money. (FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN, BEHIND) If they want to waste it-
(ENTERING) You sent her to her death.
(SIGHS) Kren.
(FX: DOOR CLOSES AS HE WALKS FORWARD) She’s still on the surface!
Garilund knew the risks.
What else did you do, Brors? Why isn’t her ComPort working?
Are you accusing me? I’d choose my next words carefully, if I were you.
Have you even tried to find her?
Computer, send for security.
Yes, Administrator.
You haven’t, have you? You haven’t even tried!
If you continue to disturb the work of the control room, I shall have you demoted. Or arrested. Or both.
Computer, who is left on the surface?

Facilitator Kren not authorised to receive test zone data.

You really want to hear she’s dead from a machine? Very well. Computer, which authorised facility staff remain within the test zone?
Authorised facility staff within the test zone: zero.
I’m sorry, Kren. I did try to warn her.
Of course there’s no authorised facility staff on the planet, because you’d already revoked her status!
You’ve had your answer.
You’re lying. (EXITS) And I’1l1 prove it.

SCENE 25: EXT. FLORENCE STREET (CLOSE BY) [CONTINUOUS]
(SOTTO) These crocodilians, Doctor! They are the ones I saw in my visions!
(SOTTO) The Phalanx of Kro. Four metre-tall thugs armed with a variety of distressingly effective weapons.
(SOTTO) I thought you wanted to speak to them?
(SOTTO) To the command caste, yes. To do that, I have to get to my vessel.
(SOTTO) What kind of vessel?
(SOTTO) Oh, you know. Wooden, oblong, with a flashing light on top. Nothing fancy.
(SOTTO) Who are you, Doctor? Where are you from?
(SOTTO) Someplace in France. ‘Gallifrey’, wasn’t it?
(SQUEAKS EXCITEDLY) Gallifrey?!? You’re a Time Lord? And your vessel, it’s a TARDIS, isn’t it?
(SOTTO) You Poldagons really are well informed.
(ALOUD) You, too, are from another world, Doctor? I suppose you are blue also, beneath your disguise?
(SOTTO) No. Keep it down, Michel.

(SOTTO) Brors?

(OFF) Look! More practice!
Doctor — the creatures have heard us!

Run!

Page 44

FX: AS BEFORE. DOOR SLIDES OPEN
(ENTERING) Larrett. Just the person I wanted to see.
(NERVOUSLY) Really?
(FX: CROSSING TO CONSOLE) This console, is it linked to the ComPort system?
FX: CONSOLE CONTROLS BEING ACTIVATED
Yes, but—
FX: CONSOLE CONTROL WARNING BLEEP

Activate the system for me, Larrett.
Maybe I should talk to Administrator Brors —

HURRYING TO CONSOLE) Yes, of course! (FX: WORKS CONTROLS
Garilund is alive. I can port her back from here, if I can

FX: CONSOLE CONTROL AFFIRMATIVE BLEEP
There, I’ve done it.
Good. Off you go now, to tell Brors where I am.
(FX: LARRETT’S FOOTSTEPS, HURRYING AWAY. DOOR OPENING AND CLOSING)
(TO HIMSELF, WORKING CONTROLS) Now then...
FX: CONSOLE BLEEPS

FX: PRESSING OF BUTTONS
Porting. Hold on Garilund.

SCENE 27: EXT. FLORENCE STREET
FX: RUNNING FOOTSTEPS
(RUNNING) How much further to your vessel?
(RUNNING) Difficult to say. Everything wasn’t in ruins and on fire when I came past here earlier.
(STOPPING, POINTING) That dark object, is that it?
Ah, yes! Well spotted.
Doesn’t exactly blend in. Chameleon circuit not working?
You really are remarkably well informed.
(STRIDING FORWARD) Come on. Once we’re aboard, you can—
FX: WARNING BLEEP-BLEEPING OF COM PORT
No. No! Not now. (SHOUTING) Nostradamus! Take my [hand —] (FX: CUT OFF BY TELEPORTATION BUZZ. SHE VANISHES )

Into the TARDIS, Michel. That part of the plan hasn’t changed!
FX: BOTH HURRY ON

SCENE 28: INT. POLDAGON LAB
FX: SHORT BUZZ AS GARILUND TELEPORTS IN
(SHOUTING) [Take my] hand! Nostradamus-!!!
(RUSHING UP) It worked! You’re here! You’re safe!
Kren-? (BEAT) Oh no. Kren, I have to go back!
What-?
FX: BLEEPING OF COMPORT BUTTONS
Help me. Reactivate my ComPort!
I did help you. I just saved your life. Brors shut down your ComPort access. He brought forward the attack. He was trying to [kill you! ]
FX: DISTANT SECURITY ALARM CUTS OVER
What’s that?
(OFF, IN CORRIDOR) Security. Alert. Former Facilitator Kren is to be found and removed from the Facility. (REPEATS)
Probably the security alert that Brors has put out for me.
Oh Kren, what have you done?
Whatever it took to save you.
You have to send me back! (FX: CONSOLE CONTROLS ACTIVATED) I have to bring that test subject back with me as proof! (FX:
BLEEP) Oh, why won’t this thing work?
The controls have been locked. They must know where we are.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 49
FX: FROM OUTSIDE, 2 x SECURITY GUARDS APPROACHING
They’re coming. We have to go!
Secondary exit, then. Come on. (RUSHING OFF) Anything else you

What?
FX: FADE

SCENE 29: INT. POLDAGON CONTROL ROOM
Port activation detected.
What? Who’s been porting?
Former second researcher Garilund’s ComPort detected.
That’s not possible. Confirm bio-identity.
Former Second Researcher Garilund bio-signs confirmed.
How was she brought here?
Her ComPort was activated from the science levels. ComPort terminus there now deactivated.
Very good. Wait, did she port in alone?
Single entity port confirmed.
(RELIEVED) So much for her plan to bring back her precious test unit. Update Security — former Second Researcher Garilund is also to be apprehended, along with former Facilitator Kren.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 51
SCENE 30: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
(TAKING IN SURROUNDINGS) This is your vessel, Doctor? (FX:
DOORS CLOSING BEHIND) But it is impossible. Impossible!
Completely. Now — (FX: THUNKS AND BLEEPS OF TARDIS CONSOLE) — we need to contact the Kro. (TO SELF) If I can just hack in to their communications path... (FX: MORE BLEEPS, RADIO STATIC)
(CROSSING TO CONSOLE) Why speak to these creatures? Surely a... ‘TARDIS’ as vast as this has weapons to use against them?
Weapons? Why would I need weapons? (FX: STATIC CLEARS) There. (INTO SCANNER) Hello? Can anyone hear me?
(D) Nuncio of the First Spear, chosen voice of the Phalanx of Kro. Who speaks?
Doctor of the Seventh, chosen voice of the TARDIS, and I demand you stop this attack on the planet Earth immediately.
(D) Earth planet? Explain.
The planet you are attacking is called Earth.
(D) Attack manoeuvres authorised under contract with planet owners and operators. You not authorised to re-negotiate terms of contract.
This is a planet! It has neither owners nor operators. I am boarding your ship, right now, to put an end to this.
(D) Authority not recognised. No negotiations. No further communication. (FX: RADIO CUTS TO STATIC, CONTINUING THROUGH: )
FX: INSISTENT PULSING SENSOR ON CONSOLE
Doctor? What does this flashing light signify?
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 52
They’re locking weapons onto us. Hold onto something, Michel. I’m taking us into emergency orbit!

KREN: Good. Off you go now, to tell Brors where I am.
KREN: (FX: LARRETT’S FOOTSTEPS, HURRYING AWAY. DOOR OPENING AND CLOSING)
KREN: (TO HIMSELF, WORKING CONTROLS) Now then...
KREN: Her ComPort’s been centrally deactivated. I knew it! Reactivating now.
KREN: Porting. Hold on Garilund.
KREN: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 47
KREN: SCENE 27: EXT. FLORENCE STREET
NOSTRADAMUS: (RUNNING) How much further to your vessel?
DOCTOR: (RUNNING) Difficult to say. Everything wasn’t in ruins and on fire when I came past here earlier.
GARILUND: (STOPPING, POINTING) That dark object, is that it?
DOCTOR: Ah, yes! Well spotted.
GARILUND: Doesn’t exactly blend in. Chameleon circuit not working?
DOCTOR: You really are remarkably well informed.
GARILUND: (STRIDING FORWARD) Come on. Once we’re aboard, you can—
GARILUND: No. No! Not now. (SHOUTING) Nostradamus! Take my [hand —] (FX: CUT OFF BY TELEPORTATION BUZZ. SHE VANISHES )
NOSTRADAMUS: She’s gone! Disappeared, into the ether!
DOCTOR: Ah. That doesn’t help at all.
DOCTOR: Into the TARDIS, Michel. That part of the plan hasn’t changed!
DOCTOR: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 48
DOCTOR: SCENE 28: INT. POLDAGON LAB
GARILUND: (SHOUTING) [Take my] hand! Nostradamus-!!!
KREN: (RUSHING UP) It worked! You’re here! You’re safe!
GARILUND: Kren-? (BEAT) Oh no. Kren, I have to go back!
KREN: What-?
GARILUND: Help me. Reactivate my ComPort!
KREN: I did help you. I just saved your life. Brors shut down your ComPort access. He brought forward the attack. He was trying to [kill you! ]
GARILUND: What’s that?
COMPUTER VOICE: (OFF, IN CORRIDOR) Security. Alert. Former Facilitator Kren is to be found and removed from the Facility. (REPEATS)
KREN: Probably the security alert that Brors has put out for me.
GARILUND: Oh Kren, what have you done?
KREN: Whatever it took to save you.
GARILUND: You have to send me back! (FX: CONSOLE CONTROLS ACTIVATED) I have to bring that test subject back with me as proof! (FX:
WARNING: BLEEP) Oh, why won’t this thing work?
KREN: The controls have been locked. They must know where we are.
KREN: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 49
KREN: They’re coming. We have to go!
GARILUND: Secondary exit, then. Come on. (RUSHING OFF) Anything else you
GARILUND: haven’t told me?
KREN: (FOLLOWING) Only that you’ve been fired and Brors has replaced you with that idiot Larrett.
GARILUND: What?
GARILUND: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 50
GARILUND: SCENE 29: INT. POLDAGON CONTROL ROOM
COMPUTER VOICE: Port activation detected.
BRORS: What? Who’s been porting?
COMPUTER VOICE: Former second researcher Garilund’s ComPort detected.
BRORS: That’s not possible. Confirm bio-identity.
COMPUTER VOICE: Former Second Researcher Garilund bio-signs confirmed.
BRORS: How was she brought here?
COMPUTER VOICE: Her ComPort was activated from the science levels. ComPort terminus there now deactivated.
BRORS: Very good. Wait, did she port in alone?
COMPUTER VOICE: Single entity port confirmed.
BRORS: (RELIEVED) So much for her plan to bring back her precious test unit. Update Security — former Second Researcher Garilund is also to be apprehended, along with former Facilitator Kren.
BRORS: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 51
BRORS: SCENE 30: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
NOSTRADAMUS: (TAKING IN SURROUNDINGS) This is your vessel, Doctor? (FX:
TARDIS: DOORS CLOSING BEHIND) But it is impossible. Impossible!
DOCTOR: Completely. Now — (FX: THUNKS AND BLEEPS OF TARDIS CONSOLE) — we need to contact the Kro. (TO SELF) If I can just hack in to their communications path... (FX: MORE BLEEPS, RADIO STATIC)
NOSTRADAMUS: (CROSSING TO CONSOLE) Why speak to these creatures? Surely a... ‘TARDIS’ as vast as this has weapons to use against them?
DOCTOR: Weapons? Why would I need weapons? (FX: STATIC CLEARS) There. (INTO SCANNER) Hello? Can anyone hear me?
FIRST NUNCIO: (D) Nuncio of the First Spear, chosen voice of the Phalanx of Kro. Who speaks?
DOCTOR: Doctor of the Seventh, chosen voice of the TARDIS, and I demand you stop this attack on the planet Earth immediately.
FIRST NUNCIO: (D) Earth planet? Explain.
DOCTOR: The planet you are attacking is called Earth.
FIRST NUNCIO: (D) Attack manoeuvres authorised under contract with planet owners and operators. You not authorised to re-negotiate terms of contract.
DOCTOR: This is a planet! It has neither owners nor operators. I am boarding your ship, right now, to put an end to this.
FIRST NUNCIO: (D) Authority not recognised. No negotiations. No further communication. (FX: RADIO CUTS TO STATIC, CONTINUING THROUGH: )
NOSTRADAMUS: Doctor? What does this flashing light signify?
NOSTRADAMUS: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 52
DOCTOR: They’re locking weapons onto us. Hold onto something, Michel. I’m taking us into emergency orbit!
DOCTOR: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 53
DOCTOR: SCENE 31: INT. CORRIDOR IN POLDAGON FACILITY
GARILUND: (RUNNING TO STOP) We need to get to another port bay, Kren. From there we can get back to the surface.
KREN: (RUNNING TO STOP) There’s no way we’ll make it without being caught. Besides, they’ll have deactivated the ComPort system by now.
GARILUND: We have to try. The man I found, Nostradamus. He’s the key.
KREN: Garilund, the odds of him surviving alone...
GARILUND: He’s not alone. I met someone else on the surface. A Time Lord.
KREN: A Time Lord? Come on.
GARILUND: I know! But he’s there. You have to believe me. —
SECURITY GUARD: (CALLING FROM OFF) You there! Stop!
KREN: Security. They’ve caught up with us.
SECURITY GUARD: (APPROACHING) I said stop! I am armed!
GARILUND: So am I.
KREN: What are you doing with that?!
SECURITY GUARD: Uuuugh! (FALLS TO GROUND)
KREN: You shot him!
KREN: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 54
GARILUND: You were the one who suggested I arm myself for the test zone! (BEAT) Look, it’s stun-only. He’ll be fine.
KREN: Yes, but still... you shot him! I think you’ve been spending too much time among the bio-units.
GARILUND: They’re people, Kren. People. And we’re going to save them. Come on. (LEAVES)
GARILUND: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 55
GARILUND: SCENE 32: INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
GARILUND: (FX: STRAINED SHUDDERING NOISE — TARDIS UNABLE TO COMPLETE MATERIALISATION. RADIO STATIC CONTINUES )
NOSTRADAMUS: Forgive me, Doctor, but... your vessel, is this normally how it travels through the heavens?
DOCTOR: No. Something’s stopping it leaving.
COMPUTER VOICE: (D) [.. Please stand by.] Attempt to remove registered property detected. Property theft is a serious breach of the standard contractual agreement. You are being diverted to the central science facility for processing. Please stand by. (REPEATS: [Attempt to remove —]
NOSTRADAMUS: More creatures from other worlds?
DOCTOR: Poldagons. Garilund’s people. They seem to think we’ve stolen something of theirs. Now they’re trying to pull us in.
NOSTRADAMUS: They can do that, to a vessel as remarkable as this?
DOCTOR: Apparently so. Remarkably well-informed, these Poldagons.
DOCTOR: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 56
DOCTOR: SCENE 33: INT. POLDAGON PUMPING STATION
KREN: (WALKING TO STOP, IN DISGUST) Where are we?
GARILUND: Somewhere down among the bio-feed pumping stations.
KREN: I don’t think I’ve been down here before.
GARILUND: That’s the point. Hopefully, they won’t think to look for us here.
KREN: Garilund, about all this...
GARILUND: I know, you don’t believe me. First bio-units with signs of higher sentience, and now I’m seeing Time Lords.
KREN: There’s higher sentience, then there's...
GARILUND: The research subject I found displayed evidence of advanced intelligence. He was capable of precognition.
KREN: But if that was possible, wouldn’t someone have discovered it already?
GARILUND: Maybe they did. And maybe Brors covered it up, just like he’s trying to do now. Let me ask you something — what’s this facility for?
KREN: Research. Pushing forward the boundaries of Poldagon science.
GARILUND: Money, Kren. It’s about money, to fund all that pushing forward of the boundaries of science. So what would happen if—
GARILUND: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 57
COMPUTER VOICE: (TANNOY, ECHOING, SLIGHTLY OFF) Alert. Product theft attempt detected. Protocols engaged. Unidentified vessel carrying copyrighted bio-unit product diverted to port bay 12.
GARILUND: Port bay 12. Right, then. (WALKS)
KREN: Garilund? Wait, where are you going?
GARILUND: Weren’t you listening? Port bay 12.
KREN: Why?
GARILUND: Because I’m willing to bet that ‘unidentified vessel’ is the Time Lord’s TARDIS.
KREN: So the bio-unit is...
GARILUND: (MOVING OFF) The one I told you about. We have to get to them.
GARILUND: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 58
GARILUND: SCENE 34: INT. KRO CONCLAVE WARSHIP
SECOND NUNCIO: (STOMPING IN, STOPS) Guard! Where is First Nuncio?
KRO GUARD: (A BIT EFFETE FOR A KRO) F-first Nuncio? Uh, not know —
FIRST NUNCIO: (STOMPING INTO SCENE) Here. First Nuncio here. What Second Nuncio want now?
SECOND NUNCIO: Honoured Nuncio of the First Spear, Conclave demands—
FIRST NUNCIO: (GROWLING) First Nuncio chosen voice of Conclave. Not you.
SECOND NUNCIO: Conclave demands to know why they were not informed of communication from planet surface?
FIRST NUNCIO: Communication invalid. Unauthorised attempt to enter contract re-negotiations.
SECOND NUNCIO: Source of communication?
FIRST NUNCIO: Speaker called Doctor of the Seventh. Vessel attacked and destroyed.
SECOND NUNCIO: Vessel not destroyed. Vessel now aboard Blueskins’ facility.
SECOND NUNCIO: Memory-records indicate Doctor of Seventh is Time Lord. Enemy of the Phalanx of Kro. His vessel valuable, destruction forbidden.
FIRST NUNCIO: (GROWLING) Second Spear Nuncio will leave now.
SECOND NUNCIO: NO. Command Conclave displeased. Second Nuncio now made First Spear Nuncio. Predecessor to surrender items of office...
SECOND NUNCIO: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 59
SECOND NUNCIO: . and brain-meat memory-inheritance of all previous First Spear Nuncios.
FIRST NUNCIO: Long-snout upstart.
SECOND NUNCIO: Short-tail incompetent.
SECOND NUNCIO: (FX: ROARS, IMPACT OF HEAVY BODIES SMASHING TOGETHER. ANGRY GROWLS, HISSES OF PAIN. IMPACT OF BODY HITTING THE GROUND.
HUNGRY: SOUNDS OF THICK SKULL BONE BROKEN OPEN AND CONTENTS
DEVOURED: )
SECOND NUNCIO: Memory inheritance... absorbed. (BELCHES )
KRO GUARD: Second Spear Nuncio...
KRO GUARD: Forgive. Honoured First Spear Nuncio. What commands?
SECOND NUNCIO: Blueskins now in breach of contract. Ready warfleet for new orders.
SECOND NUNCIO: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 60
SECOND NUNCIO: SCENE 35: INT. PORT BAY 12
DOCTOR: (STEPPING OUT) We’ve arrived.
NOSTRADAMUS: (FOLLOWING) Where?
DOCTOR: Let’s find out. (FX: CLOSES DOOR) Carefully now.
NOSTRAMADUS: Is it deserted? There are none of those Kro creatures?
DOCTOR: Nothing more alarming than uninteresting architecture and inadequate heating. (CALLING OUT) Hello? We’re your captives from Earth. Anyone here?
COMPUTER VOICE: (TANNOY) Property return confirmed. Remain where you are. Security units on their way.
DOCTOR: (MUSING TO SELF) Confirmed, yes — but how?
NOSTRADAMUS: (SLIGHTLY OFF) Doctor?
DOCTOR: (FX: JOINING HIM — WE FOLLOW) What is it?
NOSTRADAMUS: A sea of grey.
DOCTOR: Yes, all these pipes seem to be pumping it somewhere.
NOSTRADAMUS: I have seen this before. In a dream, maybe. (BEAT) Doctor, why do I feel I have been here before?
SECURITY GUARD: (OFF) There they are-!
SECURITY GUARD: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 61
BRORS: (OFF) Contain them.
NOSTRADAMUS: More blue beings, like the Lady Garilund!
DOCTOR: Poldagons. We’re their prisoners, I think.
BRORS: (WALKING FORWARD) Sincerest apologies. (STOP) I’m Brors, Chief Administrator of this facility.
DOCTOR: Or perhaps not. (TO BRORS) I’m the Doctor. This is—
BRORS: Doctor, I can’t tell you what a pleasure this is. A Time Lord. A true honour.
DOCTOR: Indeed.
NOSTRADAMUS: Excuse me, but where is the Lady Garilund?
BRORS: (TO DOCTOR) This being is with you?
NOSTRADAMUS: ‘Being’?
DOCTOR: Michel de Nostredame. Quite famous, on his homeworld.
NOSTRADAMUS: Really?
BRORS: (LAUGHS) Of course. Now, shall we?
DOCTOR: Shall we what?
BRORS: Begin your tour of the facility. So gratifying to know our achievements are known even on Gallifrey.
DOCTOR: I’m sure. And my friend here?
DOCTOR: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 62
BRORS: My guards will escort him to a secure area.
DOCTOR: I’d prefer it if he came along.
BRORS: I doubt he’d understand anything of it. A lot of complicated
BRORS: technical information.
DOCTOR: Of course. It’s alright, Michel. I’1ll see you soon.
SECURITY GUARD: Follow me.
BRORS: This way, Doctor. I think you’1ll be impressed by what we've
BRORS: achieved here.
BRORS: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 63
BRORS: SCENE 36: INT. PORT BAY 12 — OVERHEAD AREA [CONTINUOUS]
GARILUND: (SOTTO) Looks like we’re too late.
KREN: (SOTTO) That’s your Time Lord? Doesn’t look very impressive.
GARILUND: (SOTTO) Brors is giving him the VIP treatment. He must think he’s a prospective client.
KREN: (SOTTO) And the other one, your ‘higher sentience’ bio-unit? Where do you think they’re taking him?
GARILUND: (SOTTO) Imagine you’re Brors. Imagine you’ve found a bio-unit loose outside the test zone. Where would you send it?
KREN: (SOTTO) Oh.
GARILUND: (SOTTO) Exactly. You go after Nostradamus, I’1l try to get the Doctor away from Brors.
KREN: (SOTTO, LEAVING) Okay. Oh, and Garilund...
GARILUND: (SOTTO) I know. ‘Don’t shoot anyone.’ I’1l try.
GARILUND: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 64
GARILUND: SCENE 37: INT. POLDAGON CONTROL ROOM
COMPUTER VOICE: Incoming communication: spokes-being for the Command Conclave of the Phalanx of Kro. They wish to speak to Administrator Brors.
LARRETT: The Administrator is busy. And he’s ordered me to take care of some malfunctioning bio-unit. What do they want?
COMPUTER VOICE: Kro spokes-being’s voice patterns exhibiting signs of extreme agitation.
LARRETT: Put them through. I’m quite capable of negotiation. (FX: RADIO HISS) This is Third— I mean, Second Researcher Larrett.
SECOND NUNCIO: (D) This one Nuncio of the First Spear, chosen voice of the Phalanx of Kro. You speak for the Blueskins?
LARRETT: For the Poldagon science facility, yes.
SECOND NUNCIO: (D) Blueskins in breach of contract. Stolen property belonging to Kro taken from test zone. We demand return of property and immediate reparations.
LARRETT: Now, wait just a minute...
SECOND NUNCIO: (D) Phalanx negotiators coming aboard facility to begin reparations. Do not resist.
LARRETT: (RATTLED) Hello? Hello?
LARRETT: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 65
LARRETT: SCENE 38: INT. SHOWROOM
LARRETT: (FX: ELEVATOR COMES TO HALT. TECHY PING. DOORS SLIDE OPEN INTO
VAST: SPACE)
BRORS: (STEPPING OUT) Here we are, Doctor. See for yourself. I call this ‘the showroom’.
DOCTOR: (FOLLOWING) Your ‘showroom’ has an ocean inside it?
BRORS: You think that’s impressive? Just wait. (INTO AIR) Control, run Simulation 5081.
COMPUTER VOICE: Simulation commencing.
DOCTOR: It’s moving.
BRORS: No, building. This is a sea of bio-matter. We control it, every molecule. It can be anything, as long as we’ve collected enough research data.
BRORS: (FX: RUMBLING BUILDS THEN SUDDENLY STOPS. STRANGE NOISES OF BIRDSONG, CREATURES )
DOCTOR: I know this place. It’s...
BRORS: The lost jungles of Rolagtha.
DOCTOR: Burned, not lost. The whole planet was destroyed by solar flares.
BRORS: And yet we have recreated its jungles here, right down to the molecular level.
DOCTOR: So, you have he ability to recreate any environment, any lifeform. Impressive. And terrifying.
BRORS: I don’t understand.
BRORS: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 66
DOCTOR: No, but now I’m starting to. This facility. I’ve not left the planet at all, have I? I’m inside it.
BRORS: Of course. An artificial world, built to the average size of most life supporting planets.
DOCTOR: And its surface? Composed of bio-matter?
BRORS: In its raw liquid state, yes. Ready to be formed into whatever our clients desire.
DOCTOR: (TO HIMSELF) An ocean of grey...
BRORS: We can recreate any world we have on file. Any moment in its history, captured in perfect clarity.
DOCTOR: Including 16th century Earth?
BRORS: Our current clients wished to conduct an invasion training scenario on a low-tech planet. It seemed a good match.
DOCTOR: An imitation Earth, populated by imitation humans. And when your clients are finished playing with it, you just dissolve everything and reform it into something else.
BRORS: Yes. Impressive, don’t you agree?
DOCTOR: More like appalling.
BRORS: I beg your pardon?
DOCTOR: The Phalanx of Kro are monsters because the universe created them that way. What’s your excuse?
BRORS: I’m not sure I...
BRORS: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 67
DOCTOR: Serial genocide, that’s what’s going on here. Creating living
DOCTOR: world after living world, then erasing them.
BRORS: I thought you wanted to hire the facility —
DOCTOR: Quite the contrary. I’m shutting you down.
BRORS: (CALLING OUT) Control, alert Security.
DOCTOR: Call your security. I’m not leaving until I’ve safeguarded every single life on the artificial surface of your horror planet. And neither you nor your clients are going to stop
DOCTOR: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR: me.
DOCTOR: THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 68

elements.text: PART THREE
Serial genocide, that’s what’s going on here. Creating living
world after living world, then erasing them.
I thought you wanted to hire the facility —
Quite the contrary. I’m shutting you down.
(CALLING OUT) Control, alert Security.
Call your security. I’m not leaving until I’ve safeguarded every single life on the artificial surface of your horror planet. And neither you nor your clients are going to stop me.
CONTINUES INTO:
SCENE 39: INT. SHOWROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: ELEVATOR DESCENDING IN B/G
Ah, that will be the security team.
Already?
FX: TECHY PING. DOORS SLIDE OPEN
Security, remove this — [individual] (TRAILS OFF)
(STEPPING OUT, ADVANCING) Hello, Brors.
FX: LIFT DOORS SHUT BEHIND
Ah, the Lady Garilund. How nice. I, er, take it you two know
each other?
(FX: GUN CHARGING) He was my boss, until he tried to kill me.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 69
Put the gun down, Garilund. I promise you, I have no idea what you’re talking about...

Why was it you left me for dead up there, Brors? Because you suspected my theories were right? Because I threatened to report everything to the Science Academy? (ADVANCING, MENACING) The bio-units are living beings. How many of them have I helped you kill? Hundreds of millions? Billions?
Whatever your grievance, Garilund, it won’t be made better by a weapon.
FX: ELEVATOR DESCENDING IN B/G THROUGH:
(NERVOUS NOW) H-he’s right. We’re Poldagons, not bloodthirsty
creatures like the Kro. —
(TANNOY) Security team arriving at Showroom.
About time!
Doctor?
Not to worry. I know what to do in these situations.
FX: PING. DOORS SLIDE OPEN. 3 x SECURITY GUARDS CLATTER OUT
Which is?
Run!
FX: THEY RUN
(TO SECURITY TEAM) Well, don’t just stand there! After them!
FX: 3 X SECURITY GUARDS RUN AFTER DOCTOR AND GARILUND
(BEAT) Morons. (INTO AIR) Control, what’s the status of the bio-unit the Doctor brought with him?
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 70
(TANNOY) Bio-unit is being taken by Second Researcher Larrett for recycling.
Let me know as soon as it’s been disposed of.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 71
SCENE 40: INT. CORRIDOR/LAB
FX: FADE UP FOOTSTEPS
(WALKING) What’s happening? Where’s the Lady Garilund?
(WALKING) Cease talking. It is against regulations for Facility personnel to communicate with the bio-units.
(WALKING) What’s your name? Can you tell me that, at least?
(STOPPING, SIGHING) It is against regulations [for —]
(INTERRUPTING) Mine’s Michel. Michel de Nostredame. You’re going to kill me, aren’t you? I don’t need to be a seer to know that.
FX: KEYPAD BLIP. LAB DOOR SLIDES OPEN
In here.
FX: THEY WALK INTO LAB. HUM OF MACHINERY
Is this where it happens? Where you kill me? Strange, I never foresaw any of this...
Recycling.
What?
It’s called recycling. Killing is unethical. We have strict guidelines about this kind of thing. Anyway, you’re not really alive in the first place.
Then... what am I?
You’re a small mass of bio-matter programmed to act as if it’s a living being from one of the planets we have on record.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 72
But I am alive. I can think, and reason—
No, you just think you can. Look, it’s all rather technical, and you wouldn’t understand.
I can remember. I can remember my whole life.
Another being’s life. A real being. Now — lie down on this rendering slab, and we’ll get started.
You don’t understand. I see the future.
A glitch in the program, nothing more.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 73
SCENE 41: INT. SHOWROOM — CORRIDOR
FX: GURGLING PIPES. 3 x SECURITY GUARDS RUSH PAST. BEAT
(SOTTO) Did we lose them?
(SOTTO) For the moment. Come on.
FX: THEY WALK
The way you did all that...
Giant underground complex. Nefarious goings-on. Pursuit by people with guns. Second nature, really.
So where are we going?
To find Michel, of course.
Nostradamus? Why’s he so important to you?
He’s a living being. Isn’t that reason enough?
Yes, but—
And, out of everyone on the Earth above, the only person you wanted to save was him. Why? Because you think he can see the future?
He can. You heard him! He foresaw the Kro and the invasion. He even saw... (TAILS AWAY)
Ah, yes. The ocean of grey.
He saw what he really was, where he came from, even if he didn’t understand it.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 74
Precognition. A pity we don’t possess it, then we might know where they took him.
It’s alright. I sent Kren to rescue him, while I looked for you.
The young man you were talking to on your communicator? Capable type, is he?
Before today, I would have had my doubts. But now...
Excellent. Then we don’t have to worry about saving Nostradamus while we’re still trying to save ourselves. This way...
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 75
SCENE 42: INT. LAB
(ON SLAB) But — I don’t want to die.
You won’t. You’ll simply be rendered back into raw bio-matter and recycled, to be formed into something else, for whatever program we run next. It’s like living forever!
As — what? Formless ooze? Blind, unthinking, unfeeling...
(TO HIMSELF) Next time, Larrett, remember there’s a reason you’re not to talk to the bio-units. (TO NOSTRADAMUS) Okay, here we go.
FX: MACHINERY POWERING UP. DOOR OPENS BEHIND
(TESTY) Yes? What is it, Kren?
(ENTERING) Brors got you doing his dirty work now, Larrett?
It’s just — (BREAKS OFF) What are you doing with that gun?
I, er, relieved it from a security guard. I had to knock him out first, admittedly.
You’ve gone insane, Kren! What kind of Poldagon are you?
The kind that still knows the difference between research and murder. (TO NOSTRADAMUS) You! Is your name Nostradamus?
It is. Are you a friend of the Lady Garilund?
(AMUSED) ‘Lady’ Garilund? Yes, I suppose so.
Then you can take me to her? You know where she is?
I did, and now — thanks to my good friend Larrett here — I soon will again.
THE DOOMSDAY QUATRAIN by Emma Beeby & Gordon Rennie (FINAL) Page 76
I won’t help you again. You’re a renegade. A menace to Poldagon science!
Hmmm. We’1ll just see about that, shall we?
FX: ENERGY WEAPON POWERING UP

GARILUND: He can. You heard him! He foresaw the Kro and the invasion. He even saw... (TAILS AWAY)
